contentFull: Get the tools you need to effectively support the Apple environment. Learn about management, integrations and more with this comprehensive set of courses from ITProTV. Train to become an Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP).

courses.description: Mac Management Basics is the first step in the Apple IT Pro certification path. Viewers who complete this exam will be awarded the Apple Certified Associate certification. The exam covers topics related to managing Macintosh networks and focuses on topics like deploying OS X, deploying software application, controlling machines with polices, and keeping systems up to date. It is an excellent starting point for anyone tasked with managing multiple Macintosh PCs.
courses.name: ACA Mac Management Basics 10.11
courses.subtitle: Apple Certificed Associate

courses.description: The Apple Certified Associate certification is an excellent starting point for people working with Apple Mac systems in a networked environment. The certification covers topics like integrating Mac and Windows PCs as well as connecting to numerous network services. This certification course was previously titled Mac Integration Basics.
courses.descriptionMD: The Apple Certified Associate certification is an excellent starting point for people working with Apple Mac systems in a networked environment. The certification covers topics like integrating Mac and Windows PCs as well as connecting to numerous network services. This certification course was previously titled Mac Integration Basics.
courses.name: ACA Mac Integration Basics 10.13
courses.subtitle: Apple Certified Associate

courses.description: Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification confirms the candidate's understanding of macOS's core functionality as well as having the ability to configure key services, perform basic troubleshooting, and support multiple users with essential macOS capabilities. Candidates for this course may be in a role of help desk professional, technical coordinator, or power user who supports macOS users, manages networks, or provides technical support for the Mac.
courses.descriptionMD: Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification confirms the candidate's understanding of macOS's core functionality as well as having the ability to configure key services, perform basic troubleshooting, and support multiple users with essential macOS capabilities. Candidates for this course may be in a role of help desk professional, technical coordinator, or power user who supports macOS users, manages networks, or provides technical support for the Mac.
courses.name: ACSP macOS Support Essentials 10.13
courses.subtitle: Apple Certified Support Professional

courses.description: The Apple Certified Technical Coordinator certification is designed for anyone responsible for managing Apple computers and devices in a business environment. The exam is made up of content from the Support Essentials ACSP course, as well as content from the Server Essentials course which is covered in this show. Technologies covered include topics like network deployment, policy management, troubleshooting and using Open Directory for centralized user management.
courses.name: ACSP macOS Server Essentials 10.11
courses.subtitle: Apple Certified Support Professional

courses.description: The Managing macOS Servers series is designed to demonstrate how to use and deploy the macOS server app in a production environment. It covers installation, configuration and maintenance of the various services that make up the macOS server app. In addition, the series covers alternate services that can be used as replacements to services that are no longer supported natively by Apple.
courses.descriptionMD: The Managing macOS Servers series is designed to demonstrate how to use and deploy the macOS server app in a production environment. It covers installation, configuration and maintenance of the various services that make up the macOS server app. In addition, the series covers alternate services that can be used as replacements to services that are no longer supported natively by Apple.
courses.name: Managing macOS Servers 10.13
courses.subtitle: macOS Server
